alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 05 at 8:17PM CDT until June 10 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Kansas... Smoky Hill River at Enterprise affecting Dickinson County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Cottonwood River near Emporia affecting Lyon County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River near Emporia. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, North bank of the Cottonwood River begins to flood. Lowland flooding occurs along the Cottonwood River from Plymouth to Neosho Rapids. At 24.0 feet, Highway K 99 on the south bank floods. At 25.5 feet, Highway K 99 on the north bank begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 19.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 25.1 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/top/.
